channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump says Nvidia will hand the U.S. 15% of its H20 chip sales to China
item.description: The president said that Nvidia would pay the government in exchange for easing export restrictions — and that he'd initially asked for a larger cut.

item.title: Ford says it will roll out a cheaper electric pickup truck
item.description: Ford announced it will retool its Louisville Assembly Plant to focus on electric trucks. Its goal: to bring down prices for U.S. buyers and compete wi...

item.title: Judge denies release of Ghislaine Maxwell grand jury transcripts
item.description: President Trump called for the release of the grand jury transcripts after growing pressure to divulge more information about Jeffrey Epstein's case, ...

item.title: Trump says he will 'feel out' Putin in Alaska on ending the war in Ukraine
item.description: President Trump says he thinks Russian President Vladimir Putin is ready to end his war on Ukraine, but he will use a Friday summit to "feel out" his ...

item.title: European Leaders Insist Ukraine Must be Part of Peace Talks
item.description: EU foreign ministers meet ahead of Friday’s Trump-Putin talks in Alaska, with Brussels insisting any peace deal must include Ukraine. And Al Jazeera’s...

item.title: Explosions at US Steel plant in Pennsylvania leave 1 dead, 1 missing, 10 injured
item.description: Explosions at a U.S. Steel plant that shook the ground near Pittsburgh left one dead and sent at least 10 to hospitals with emergency workers still se...

item.title: Trump deploys National Guard to Washington DC and pledges crime crackdown
item.description: The president also takes control of the city's police force, as the mayor rejects his claims of a crime wave.

item.title: Sec. McMahon kicks off tour promoting state-led education
item.description: Education Secretary Linda McMahon is touring the country to promote state-led education plans.

item.title: Tropical Storm Erin forms, could become Atlantic's first hurricane this season
item.description: Tropical Storm Erin was expected to become a hurricane later in the week.

item.title: 3 dead, suspect in custody after shooting at Target in Austin
item.description: Three people were killed and a suspect was arrested after a shooting at a Target store parking lot in North Austin, police said.

item.title: Zelensky could still attend Trump-Putin meeting, but rest of Europe is shut out
item.description: As things stand, there are no invites for the country being invaded, nor the continent it sits in, writes James Waterhouse.

item.title: At least 1 killed, 1 missing after explosions at U.S. Steel Clairton plant
item.description: At least one person has died, and one person remains unaccounted for, while at least 10 people have been injured following multiple explosions at the ...

item.title: Trump says he will try to get back territory for Ukraine in talks with Putin
item.description: The US president says talks with Putin on Friday will be a "feel-out meeting" aimed at urging Russia to end the war in Ukraine.

item.title: Paramount acquires UFC rights in 7-year deal with TKO Group
item.description: Paramount will become the new home to all UFC events in the U.S., while UFC's CEO says the White House may host a July 4 event broadcast on CBS.

item.title: Police say 3 dead in a shooting at a Target in Austin, Texas, and a suspect has been detained
UN condemns targeted Israeli attack that killed five Al Jazeera journalists
item.description: Israel says it targeted correspondent Anas al-Sharif, accusing him of leading a Hamas cell, which he had denied. Israel provided little evidence for t...

item.title: Chip giants Nvidia and AMD to pay 15% of sales revenue in China to US
item.description: The chip giants will hand revenues to the US government in exchange for licences to export to China.

item.title: Trial starts over Trump administration’s deployment of National Guard to Los Angeles
